website_summaries.verdict: Good quality of organic chia seeds that have a neutral taste, making them a nice mix-in.
pros: Works well as a vegan option for an egg substitute
High levels of protein, omega fats, and fiber
Certified organic chia seeds that won't affect the taste of foods where you mix the seeds
cons: Occasional problems with quality control, product contamination, and product freshness

customer_reviews.title: Best Deal Around for the Size
customer_reviews.text: I love Viva chia seeds! The price for this amount of chia seeds is unbeatable. I use them so many ways, they're a great way to get protein and omegas if you eat minimal meat like me. My favorite ways to eat them: 1/4 c soaked overnight with 1/2 c almond milk and a splash of vanilla to make a delicious pudding that I top with strawberries for breakfast. In winter I add a bit of cinnamon & maple syrup and then soak them and top with apple pieces and walnuts. Blended with frozen fruit then soaked overnight to make a jam that's great on toast or in yogurt parfaits. I've even added them to muffin batter with delicious results.
customer_reviews.author: Smile SaurusTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: The expiry dates are becoming worst.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second times order this production. The Expiration dates reduce from 10/2019 to 7/2019. That makes me so disappointed. Update: 3/June/ 2018. Come on. This is my third order because my friend ask me to buy it for her. And this time is also a terrible expiry date 10/31/2018. What are you, Amazon doing to me??????????? yes, it is not out of date but when I give it for some one as a gift, I will be so embarrassing. I really get angry. Lost my money and receive terrible service.
customer_reviews.author: Rubibong

customer_reviews.title: Full of Cobwebs Inside
customer_reviews.text: I cracked open the bag and there were webs all over the inside of the bag. I'm not sure what type of insect created these webs but, I'm not planning on finding out.
customer_reviews.author: Edubya

customer_reviews.title: Economical and delicious way to get a big dose of omega 3!
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my veggie protein shake and/or tea. After soaking for a few minutes it thickens the beverage. Very high in omega 3 and economical
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: I threw the rest in the garbage.
customer_reviews.text: There seems to be some kind of grit in with these seeds. I don't know if it is sand or what, but after I happened upon it a couple times, I threw the rest in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Kathlene

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Second package I bought. I opened it two months ago and today when I opened the package, it had a bunch of worms. Expiration date is 10/31/18
customer_reviews.author: Jaz-_-

customer_reviews.title: I love the health benefits of these chia seeds
customer_reviews.text: I love the health benefits of these chia seeds. They add volume to my homemade pudding and they keep me full. What I do is take 1 tablespoon of chia seeds 1 scoop of chocolate protein 3/4 cup almond milk a few drops of stevia and blend everything together. Let it sit in the refriderator 4 hours or overnight and it makes a great healthy snack.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Chocolate Strawberry Chia Pudding😋😋😋😋
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my Chocolate Strawberry Chia Pudding!!! Yummy 😋 😋😋👇🏻👇🏻👇🏻👇🏻 1/3 cup chia seeds 1 1/4 cup almond milk 2 T maple syrup 1/4 tsp sea salt 1/2 cup sliced strawberries 2 T chocolate cocoa (I used viva cocoa) Mix all the ingredients together in a large bowl. Make sure you mix very well because the seeds have a tendency to clump at the bottom. If you want to make it extra chocolaty, you can add 2 tablespoons cocoa to it. Store in the fridge for 3 hours to set. This should last 4-5 days in the fridge. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Tada

customer_reviews.title: LIVE BUGS IN THE CHIA SEEDS
customer_reviews.text: I was eating these chia seeds for the past month, and today I noticed there were several tiny bugs crawling around when I scooped out a tablespoon. I then found more crawling around inside the container, which I immediately closed and threw out. Absolutely disgusting and unacceptable, and I can't even get a refund. I will never buy anything from this brand again, and you shouldn't either.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: good purity
customer_reviews.text: I've been experimenting with how to eat these. I mostly make a bowl of glop, adding water and flavorings. Considering that there are zillions of tiny seeds in the bag (has anyone counted them?), and so far I haven't found any stones or impurities, it's kind of remarkable. Good quality product. I noticed that the bag is made of layers of something metallic and something like paper and/or plastic- hi tech. But light comes through the bag where there are wrinkles, suggesting that it is not well sealed. So I moved the seeds to another container which also is much easier to pour from and re-seal.
customer_reviews.author: swell

customer_reviews.title: Good product and the price seems right...
customer_reviews.text: Good product and the price seems right. I soak about a tablespoon of seeds in about a 1/2 cup of water for about 1/2 hour and mix it with orange juice every morning. I don't do this because I enjoy it and while not yucky and not sure I feel the health benefits, from everything I have read the benefits are real.
customer_reviews.author: PAC

customer_reviews.title: Unsealed bag of Chia delivered.
customer_reviews.text: The bag was not sealed. Seeds were everywhere. I cannot eat food that comes in an open container. Quality control must be non-existent. UPDATE: In less than 24 hours I got a replacement bag and everything was as it should be. Hopefully, the unsealed bag was a fluke, never to happen again.
customer_reviews.author: David J Brasher

customer_reviews.title: These will not sprout
customer_reviews.text: I tried a few times to sprout these, but nothing. The last time, I placed these on one half of the tray and another brand of seeds on the other half. After 3 or 4 days, the side with the other brand had green shoots popping up everywhere. After another couple days, the side with this brand still shows no signs of anything growing. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Teto

customer_reviews.title: so my item came in a box and when i ...
customer_reviews.text: so my item came in a box and when i took it out all the seeds were falling all over the place......i then noticed a piece of tape holding the hole together hoping that i wouldn't notice.....i am beyond pissed and would appreciate my money back.....i won't order this from online again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bravo

customer_reviews.title: WORMS!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I'm not an extremely squeamish person. Chia seeds are a natural product, and the idea that there might be a few bug legs and whatnot in there doesn't bother me. So a few months ago when I discovered that my bag of chia was TEEMING with worms (mealworms?) I just discarded it and ordered another. I figured it was a fluke. Well, yesterday some sort of wormy larvae reared its head from my measuring spoon just like in Alien! I'm done with this brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Olson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Smoothie Ingredient
customer_reviews.text: I am now on my 2nd bag of Viva Chia Seeds and am very satisfied with the product. I add them to my smoothies several times weekly. I also use several other Viva products and would certainly recommend them also.
customer_reviews.author: Illinois Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Opened and spilling seeds
customer_reviews.text: This item arrives opened with his seeds all over inside the box. Total bummer.
customer_reviews.author: allison dunham

customer_reviews.title: I recieved old chia seeds
customer_reviews.text: So i like the chia seeds and have used them for my bones but the problem i have is not with the product is the fact that amazon sent it to me with an expiry date of August this year. I ordered these in March. How on earth can i use 2lbs of chia that fast. Very very disappointed. Im a regular customer and i deserve better than this. I only rate in order to state my disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy the crunchiness and added vegetable protein from the Chia seeds in my salads.
customer_reviews.text: Been using Chia seeds now for over six months and I really enjoy them in salads - which usually don't fill me up as a meal, but with the seeds I'm very satisfied. I originally started using them because I was having trouble with low blood sugar levels. They seemed to help me without a lot of calories from sugar. Now that I have my levels balanced, I just enjoy the crunchiness and added vegetable protein in my salads:O)
customer_reviews.author: Elvera

customer_reviews.title: Found fly in the seeds
customer_reviews.text: Horrible.. found a fly in the seeds. Bought organic assuming product quality will be good. Will never buy this again
customer_reviews.author: KAPILPEDDI

customer_reviews.title: Cha Cha Cha Chia!  Ignore the leafy growths on your head and partake
customer_reviews.text: Hey, doctors and nutritionists say its good for me. Who am i to argue? Are these the same things as a kid you sprinkled on pots sculptures? Oh well, so far i gather no moss. I sprinkle these in smoothies, oatmeal. A tablespoon here and there to get a bit extra fiber and nutrition in my meals. I have no proof that this helps other than the advice of professionals but I can say for me I have noticed no negative side effects.whatsoever. I like VIVA for my nutritional organic additive products. They provide good quality resealable packaging and a very reasonable and competitive price.
customer_reviews.author: BuzzlitebeerTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Great price for organic chia seeds
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for organic chia seeds and found these on amazon warehouse so I snapped them up. For what I was looking for these were a great price everything else I was looking at was at least triple the price even with subscribe and save 15% off. My younger daughter has an egg allergy and I use chia seeds to substitute eggs in recipes for baking so this is perfect. Also my older daughter likes chia seeds with her oatmeal and I like to sneak them in their smoothies. Not that these have much of a taste but they looked fine when I opened the package and tasted fine when I tried them.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Worms in Package
customer_reviews.text: I opened the packaging to find worms. After reading reviews other buyers also had the same issue
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Value
customer_reviews.text: This has become my favourite brand of chia seeds. Very healthy and extremely affordable for the quantity you’re receiving. I use this to to make one of my favourite breakfast choices - cold brew chia pudding, which is a combination of cold brew coffee, chia seeds, almond milk, and a type of sweetener stirred together and soaked overnight. The seeds are high quality and I couldn’t recommend it more. Anyone who loves chia seeds, anyone who hasn’t tried it yet, the quality beats out the price. Definitely give it a chance.
customer_reviews.author: Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Was advised by a friend to eat these seeds daily for better intestinal health. I think they work great. They don’t have a taste and can be added to many foods. I eat them in my oatmeal or yogurt for breakfast and they give it a little extra crunch. The price for this bad was a much better value than what I found in the supermarket. This is a very large bag and will last a long time. I bought another bag to give to my Mom.
customer_reviews.author: Codi

customer_reviews.title: Chia Seeds Everywhere...Except in My Mouth!
customer_reviews.text: The product was damaged (a hole in the bag) and the chia seeds had spilled into the box. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ansevi

customer_reviews.title: Love my Bento!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can portion my food, it doesn't leak and I can separate my fruits, salad, soup etc. That being said, the only thing that drives me crazy is the fork, spoon and Knife included with the Bento. They work great, except that they don't stay in place. You may think, "so what"? My point is that I want them to stay in place...that's what the holder was made for, to make all 3 utensils stay in place. They need to work on that little glitch....., I still love it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elba

customer_reviews.title: Quality seeds, terrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: These chia seeds taste great and seem clean. Unfortunately, the reseal on the bag is horrible and I have lost many chia seeds to my vacuum after the 2 times the bag dumped everywhere. I now roll and rubberband the bag shut.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney F.

customer_reviews.title: I use in homemade bread. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I use in homemade bread. Great stuff. Last a very long time. I soak 3 tablespoons in a cup of warm water and add to my mixture in place of eggs for my organic homemade bread. Very good product . I will buy again when I run out but I think it’s been a year now! When I make smoothies again I will put a few in but be careful because they do tend to use water in your body as well when not soaked first. They are also good for weight loss of which I don’t have a problem. I don’t use many but they are very nutritional.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Mowrey BMTop Contributor: Karaoke

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Product was damaged and cause disaster in the box. Damaged other product as well.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: ... vivalab chia seed before (with the old packaging) and happy with the quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought vivalab chia seed before (with the old packaging) and happy with the quality, the old packaging was more durable. The new packaging is fragile. I bought 10 packages, 2/10 were torn. The bag is just bigger than needed and the material is not durable. When I opened the amazon box, the seeds came out from these packages (see pictures) and dirty my carpet....
customer_reviews.author: D.P.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Chia Seeds
customer_reviews.text: Chia seeds are supposed to be black or white. These are brown which indicates an immature seed that has far less nutritional value. I opened the bag today which is after the return date. I will see if Amazon will make an exception.
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: Great price, Tastes dirty
customer_reviews.text: Love how cheap this product was for how much you get, but it tasted so much like dirt. There was no dirt in the bag but I've definitely had better tasting chia seeds. Haven't used them much since I got them because the idea was for me not to have to add any sugar so my challenge is just making them taste good. LOL
customer_reviews.author: User19384920

customer_reviews.title: Yuck
customer_reviews.text: Never herd of anyone getting sick on Chia Seeds, but I do 😝😝
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: the first bag was great, no weird taste or smell
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this chia seed twice so far... the first bag was great, no weird taste or smell... the second bag, however, had a weird muddy smell to it and actually had tiny grains of dirt mixed in... I'm not sure if I just got a bad batch of it
customer_reviews.author: GLee

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful first experience with chia seeds
customer_reviews.text: I'd read some reviews of other brands containing little bugs and rocks so I was very cautious about trying these, but this brand lives up to its reviews. Just perfect little seeds, and such a great quantity for the price! I add them to my smoothies to make them more filling and have not been disappointed at all. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Economical AND Organic!
customer_reviews.text: I like the big bag that will last s very long time. I don’t have any interest in making chia puddings. They look disgusting to me and I don’t like pudding period. I do use these seeds in my smoothies. They have no taste which is good. They make you regular but I have never had an issue with regularity. I may try them on my salad but I will use them for smoothies mostly. I know my skin is smoother. I don’t know if that’s due to the water or the matcha tea I’m drinking. If you’re looking for a chia product to try, start here!
customer_reviews.author: BLOSSOM

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to get an item I can't find at the grocery store
customer_reviews.text: My local grocery store doesn't have a bulk foods section and something fairly specialty like this would probably cost 2-3x what it does here. So far I've only made chia seed pudding and thrown in a teaspoon or so into oatmeal, but I'm a fan! Chia seed pudding in particular is a great way to get a sweet fix that isn't too sweet and is still pretty healthy & filling. The seeds taste good, look right, and the bag arrived intact.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Blatz

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to try this as a new breakfast. It took 4 times more than recommended to make a simple chia pudding. And then... Spent my day on the toilet. Not fun. Wish I could have my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: Yummy chia seeds.
customer_reviews.text: I've been eating chia seeds for over 5 years and this is the best one I've bought. I love that it is organic. I put a tablespoon in my 2G Yogurt (2 grams of sugar / 2 carbs). It helps me get extra fiber. I also make my own chia seed drinks. I use Axio. I also make a simple chia, low carb pudding.
customer_reviews.author: D. Easter

customer_reviews.title: Not from the USA
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were from the USA. They were from Mexico and their organic standards are different than ours.
customer_reviews.author: love to garden

customer_reviews.title: Not good taste
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a different brand of chia but the price was increased and I decided to try this brand. Maybe I just got a bad bag but (I looked and it wasn’t expired) these seeds tasted bitter and yucky! I also noticed they didn’t seem to absorb as much water and gel as much. If you’re eating these mixed with other foods you probably won’t notice the flavor but if you care about how your chia tastes, maybe look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: redhaired scandinavian

customer_reviews.title: Raise your EPA levels
customer_reviews.text: I trust Viva brand products. I went to an Integrative Medicine doc who ran some blood work and discovered that my EPA (usually from fish oil) was on the low side in relation to my DHA. She made a few suggestions, one of which is Chia seeds to boost my EPA. I put a teaspoon in my oatmeal every meal. She also liked walnuts as a good source of EPA.
customer_reviews.author: Nitty's Mom

customer_reviews.title: the only chia seeds i buy
customer_reviews.text: love these little guys. they're the only chia seeds i buy. they really do help with my nutritional needs a lot and i can honesly tell the difference on the days when i don't eat them versus that days that i do add them to each meal. you don't need a lot. just a spoonful on top of each meal makes a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: John Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It's delicious and chia seeds are so healthy and good for us all
customer_reviews.text: I eat a "pudding" of chia seeds and almond milk with honey and cinnamon every morning. It's delicious and chia seeds are so healthy and good for us all. These a well-priced and the Viva organic chia seeds are wonderful. I also toss a teaspoon or so into my daily smoothie for the extra vitamins and minerals and also to thicken the smoothie. They're tasteless so they don't alter the flavor of whatever you add them to.
customer_reviews.author: Susan from Tampa Bay

customer_reviews.title: Help is this Rat feces!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My sec time buying this viva, the first was ok but this sec bag I'm finding small black stuff lookin alot like Rat droppings, this is disgusting!!
customer_reviews.author: Shevis Webster

customer_reviews.title: Fresh wonderful chia!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg..I could not be HAPPIER with this chia!!!!!! The seeds are FRESH and packaged BEAUTIFULLY.!!!!! This is a stand up company,and I will continue to order only from them!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: murphy

customer_reviews.title: chia seeds???
customer_reviews.text: these seeds do not open up or thicken like seeds i have gotten from others.not sure if they are chia
customer_reviews.author: wolfgangsta

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Spent the majority of my life with constipation and I’ve had to use cascara sagrada daily for decades. Finally started adding these and everything is perfect. I soak 3 tablespoons in creamy oat milk (don’t do Quaker oat milk or Silk brand) overnight and then sip at the pudding the next day.
customer_reviews.author: kirsten

customer_reviews.title: Chia seeds are a quick and easy-to-use source of protein ...
customer_reviews.text: Chia seeds are a quick and easy-to-use source of protein, healthy fats, dietary fiber, minerals, vitamins, and antioxidants, all rolled into one neat package. Although they have similar health benefits to flax seeds, seeds may soon edge these out because they don't have to be ground prior to consumption, and they don't go rancid as quickly either. It work well as an exfoliant and buffing agent to add to your beauty care routine. Spa Index has a simple recipe for a homemade exfoliating scrub using just three ingredients
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: I find that this proportion is my favorite for drinking the seeds
customer_reviews.text: I've been using chia seeds for about 2 years now. I try to have a tablespoon in a liter of water 3 to 4 times a week for the fiber intake. I find that this proportion is my favorite for drinking the seeds, as it makes it like a slightly slimy melted slushy rather than a thick pudding. There is a scent and flavor to them, but I don't find it to be overpowering or off-putting.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fiber needs.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product. They have no taste, so I mix them into ice cream or yogurt. It's a great way to get the fiber you need in a natural and efficient dose. The concentration of fiber makes it easy to mix these little guys into any meal or schedule. It will make a huge difference in your digestive health.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Wanted more fiber
customer_reviews.text: I add this to my oatmeal every morning. As a person with Type 2 Diabetes, I am trying to increase my fiber grams as well as lose weight. I don't really taste the chia seeds with the oatmeal. I use unsweetened almond milk, and add fresh strawberries and blueberries, and pecan pieces to the cooked oatmeal.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kanter

customer_reviews.title: Came expired once.  Were fine other times
customer_reviews.text: I'm very upset with my last purchase as I received expired chia seeds I've gotten probably like 10 bags of these so I don't think it's necessarily the Brans fault but when I open them they were expired and smell rancid I tried to eat them but when I research if they were still okay I found out they were not okay so I had to throw them away. Like I said every other time they were fine
customer_reviews.author: Saverio mastrianni

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: Mix 1/2 cup of this with 2 cups organic unsweetend almond milk, some cinnamon and organic stevia powder to taste. Helps to heal the stomach.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff F

customer_reviews.title: Perfect augmentation to health.
customer_reviews.text: I like the price and that they are stated to be organic. I have stenosis due to a spinal cord injury and partially paralyzed and discovered that adding chia seeds throughout the day is terrific for my paralyzed bowels and doctors never mentioned this.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Savvy

customer_reviews.title: Always pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: Always pleased with this product. I have very sensitive taste and smell and have been a chef for over ten years so I know quality when I see it, smell it, and taste it. I've tasted the product they sell at Walmart(not always consistent) and I have tried the chia we buy at my work(one of the biggest hotel chains in the world) and it has a musty moldy taste. Also the consistencies I find in other chia brands. Viva always tastes great and I will continue to buy this product as long as it stays at this quality. 500 stars.
customer_reviews.author: john rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Chia Seeds
customer_reviews.text: Great price on Amazon compared to grocery stores and especially health food stores. Fresh seeds and high quality product. We add it to our homemade oat cereal. A 1 ounce (28 grams) serving of chia seeds contains: •Fiber: 11 grams. •Protein: 4 grams. •Fat: 9 grams (5 of which are Omega-3s). •Calcium: 18% of the RDA. •Manganese: 30% of the RDA. •Magnesium: 30% of the RDA. •Phosphorus: 27% of the RDA. •They also contain a decent amount of Zinc, Vitamin B3 (Niacin), Potassium, Vitamin B1 (Thiamine) and Vitamin B2. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Steve Taylor

customer_reviews.title: damaged pouch
customer_reviews.text: The product is in a pouch that has a hole in it. So many of the chia seeds leaked out into the shipping envelope. How do I know if these seeds are fresh since the pouch is not sealed? I saw in the reviews that other people had this problem, but I thought that I would take a chance.
customer_reviews.author: daveg

customer_reviews.title: A small amount goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: This was the first time I got these and I made a mistake on the amount to use. You dont need much of these and they grow plenty on your water after 30 mins of leaving it in water. I put this on my water every day. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tedeva

customer_reviews.title: Possible quality issues: compressed or moisture in bag as chia was clumped together
customer_reviews.text: Some of the Chias came compressed together as cakes; not sure if water or moisture got into the bag so not comfortable consuming this.
customer_reviews.author: Private User

customer_reviews.title: Bad taste
customer_reviews.text: These taste like dirt or mold. Other brands have much better taste.
customer_reviews.author: Aardvark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these Chia Seeds for nearly 2 years in my smoothies. Quality is excellent! I soak them overnight in coconut milk which makes for a great texture in my morning smoothie. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: roadfever

customer_reviews.title: Good, fulfilling seeds
customer_reviews.text: Excellent chia seeds, they taste fresh and keep me full. I have about 30ml of seeds with a 16.9oz bottle of water at 9:00 AM. Keeps my stomach from growling until about 6:00 PM
customer_reviews.author: Woj

customer_reviews.title: Great Chia seeds
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit nervous about ordering these based on some reviews about contamination but I ordered 2 of these bags 2 weeks apart from each other and both packages had no issues at all. Apart from this these are Chia seeds and taste really good so not quite sure what more there is to review LOL :)
customer_reviews.author: kevin374

customer_reviews.title: First time Chia Seed buyer
customer_reviews.text: I'd never used Chia Seeds before, but I'm loving them now! They sure seem fresh, they taste great (I love them in my Chia Seed pudding!), they store easily in my refrigerator. I'm glad I found them here at such a good price as I'm going through them pretty quickly. This was a good Amazon find and purchase. I am about to buy my second bag....
customer_reviews.author: cb

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for smoothies and there are great! Nice flavor and texture. The packaging is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Broady

customer_reviews.title: Mouse poop!!! Beware!!!
customer_reviews.text: Gross. All I can say...just gross, disgusted and beyond disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: clvrgrl24

customer_reviews.title: tiny bugs
customer_reviews.text: mine had a bunch of very little bugs in it i had to dump it all out :( i showed my mom and she didn’t even see them until i took one out individually and it was crawling around my hand , i was looking everywhere good chia seeds without this problem and thought this one would fit but sadly no , just be careful and check your bags.
customer_reviews.author: monica

customer_reviews.title: Tasty
customer_reviews.text: These chia seeds are great. Large, resealable bag. I add these to my coconut water, I like the nutty flavor and crunch. Even once they absorb liquid, they don't get too slimy. No issues whatsoever with freshness.
customer_reviews.author: Punahele

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but I like the Nutiva better.
customer_reviews.text: The Nutiva Brand has an amazing smell. This one isn't bad, but not as good as the other option I tried.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Food
customer_reviews.text: In the description, they all say that they are very healthy food, and I tried it for a while to evaluate it! The taste is tasteless, but you can often add yogurt and juice to eat a good choice,But for now, I don’t feel much change to my body
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Trying to eat more healthily, it's nice to know these seeds were organically produced
customer_reviews.text: We use chia seeds in a protein shake recipe that we like, making the shake the night before so the seeds have a chance to soften and add bulk to the drink. While we're able to find bulk chia seeds locally, I don't know where they come from or how they are produced. These chia seeds cost less, but I really like that they are organically produced. I also like the heavy, re-sealable bag, which makes it easy to grab a few tablespoonsful without getting them all over. The bag also sits nicely on the shelf, no sagging.
customer_reviews.author: MysteryPoodle

customer_reviews.title: Good nutrition!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time to try Chia Seeds. I like them. I have used them as an egg substitute, I sprinkle them on my oatmeal and salads. I have even added them to my spaghetti sauce and my black beans. You can sneak added nutrition to foods that are dark (like spaghetti sauce and black beans) without anyone noticing. They are loaded with fiber, protein, Omega-3 fatty acids and various micronutrients. When sprinkled on cereal or salad, they add a crunch without changing the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: pegred

customer_reviews.title: Fresh and Fair Price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these Chia Seeds purposely to add to morning breakfast smoothies. They are small seeds, all the better. Fresh and the price was right. Came in an airtight sealed pouch, inside a protective airtight pouch. Good value, good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie Bosley

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I use chia seeds mostly for drinking with fruit juice. Some brands that I've used you can put them with juice and they're ready to drink in a few hours. These on the other hand, you definitely have to leave them overnight or they don't soften completely and have a pretty unpleasant earthy taste. After I figured that out these are pretty much my go to chia seeds. Pretty good price and great quality in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Pimpshrimp247

customer_reviews.title: Mild flavor, fresh.
customer_reviews.text: The nutrition book I have said don't get the dark colored ones as they look like bugs. But these seemed well priced and well rated so I ordered them. This is the first time I have eaten Chia seeds so didn't really know what to expect. They are very small and taste good to me; they are mild flavored. I sprinkle on yogurt for breakfast and enjoy the slight crunch. I didn't think they looked like bugs. I would expect bugs to be moving. lol I think the extra nutrition is a great idea. I will use them in baked goods and sprinkle on salads.
customer_reviews.author: rulrich

customer_reviews.title: Good smelling and clean
customer_reviews.text: I started getting nervous after I read reviews for this chia product (and most other organic chia products on Amazon) and had reports of things in there that you don't want. This is the second bag of Viva that I've ordered, and no complaints, tastes great.
customer_reviews.author: SNACK D

customer_reviews.title: CHa cha cha CHIA!
customer_reviews.text: Good value, after shopping around settled on this giant bag that will last me a while. It's great to have this in my pantry as Chia is versatile in use, so I can sneak it into normal everyday cooking for some extra nutrition but I mainly use it to spruce up my overnight oats. Really great quality and love the resealable bag so the seeds will keep fresh.
customer_reviews.author: JigglyTofu

customer_reviews.title: After a good deal of research on chia seeds I've learned they're ...
customer_reviews.text: Its difficult for me to make an accurate assessment of the quality of these because it was my first time preparing chia seeds. They seem to be what they should be! I have learned that LESS is MORE when it comes to these, especially when soaking them in any kind of liquid. They are mostly flavorless and they add texture. After a good deal of research on chia seeds I've learned they're incredible for your health. I will probably be buying this brand again because of the price and fast prime shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best price ANYWHERE!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy these after reading some of the reviews. Mine arrived perfect. My local Publix grocery store charges $9.99 for a cup of seeds!!!! This bag will last me a long time! I use what I need, fold the top over and tape, then keep it in the freezer so I don't have to worry about the web issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M. Sering Young

customer_reviews.title: but I felt as long as I chased it down with water it would be fine and it was
customer_reviews.text: Chia seeds are almost magical since they plump up and absorb water. I was nauseated the other day and decided to try and eat 1 ts of dry seeds with a glass of water in hopes that it would absorb excess stomach acid and help with the nausea. It made it go away completely. I did read somewhere on the internet though to be careful about eating the seeds dry since it could get caught and expand, but I felt as long as I chased it down with water it would be fine and it was, but am still very careful.
customer_reviews.author: Jorgenson

customer_reviews.title: Good Nutrish and Crunch!
customer_reviews.text: I eat half avocado mixed with cottage cheese and gluten free toast every single morning. I have gluten allergy. I add chia for texture. When I don't have it I miss it even though there is no taste. It's all about texture.
customer_reviews.author: Seaside Designer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I order this through subscribe and save every month. I use 2 tablespoon a day which lasts about a month. This product has been similar to other organic brands I have bought. No strange taste or odor. Not a bulky bag. I use them for good fat and fiber.
customer_reviews.author: Fuschia Eastwood

customer_reviews.title: Great for Weightloss
customer_reviews.text: This product aides in weightloss as long as you eat healthy. I use it in my coffee in the mornings & in my oatmeal at night.
customer_reviews.author: Charisse

customer_reviews.title: Quality chia seeds
customer_reviews.text: I can't say that I've ever had "bad" chia seeds, so I would consider these a good purchase. The quantity vs cost is what sold me, and these seem to be a quality product, as well. If you enjoy chia seeds, you've probably got a good idea as to how to incorporate them into your diet, and you probably know by now that they don't have a strong flavor on their own. The one thing I can say definitively is that these make an awesome chia pudding when combined with coconut milk and cocoa powder.
customer_reviews.author: Lutzie

customer_reviews.title: Delivery sucked on this! Package seam burst causing a mess! Not happy!
customer_reviews.text: This came with the seal busted on packaging. Chia seeds all over!
customer_reviews.author: falenedeon

customer_reviews.title: Goodness for your body
customer_reviews.text: So easy to enjoy. I sprinkle these into all types of foods, on salads, and even eat them by the spoonful. Nothing to lose and extra goodness for my body! Company is very easy to work with too.
customer_reviews.author: kates

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with these Chia Seeds
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with the delivery, the packaging, the apparent healthful aspects of the chia seeds and esp. their lack of processing, etc. I compared the health benefits/nutrients of three good seeds and decided these were best for my needs. I also ordered an extra package for my son who has a health issue or two. Maybe another time ill also order the other two seeds and mix all three together. I sprinkle the Chia seeds on my Greek yogurt with berries, on my cereal, salads, soup, just about anything. I also happen to enjoy the light crunch. Don't know if it makes a difference, but i store the package in my refrigerator.,O yes, another plus for me: No grinding necessary.
customer_reviews.author: carolkrafter

customer_reviews.title: GREAT value!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using chia seeds in my oatmeal for breakfast for about 2 years now, since a trainer at the gym helped me straighten out my food selections. I always kind of blanched when I bought them at the grocery, though....it finally occurred to me I should check out Amazon's offerings to see if I could get quality seeds for a little less. And I did! Viva packages a great product, in a sturdy bag, containing a generous amount for MUCH less than I've been paying at the store. I am very grateful and so glad I found them!
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to a healthy diet
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with chia seeds. After reading about all the benefits of these tiny seeds I decided to give them a try. Good choice! They become a subtle part of whatever they are placed with. Great for thickening smoothies and they take on the taste of what they are incorporated with. Also make a very tasty and interesting chocolate pudding, almost tapioca-like. As a healthy addition to my diet I highly recommend them. I will continue to incorporate them into my diet and reap the benefits. There are so many recipes for their use and these seeds are mild with the added important fact that they are organic and non-gmo.
customer_reviews.author: samsgang

customer_reviews.title: Make your own chia drinks.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to make Chia gel to put in my health drinks. I'm very happy with the product. The price is good. I'm saving SO much money making my own chia kombucha drinks. Pairs well with MOCU kombucha drink mix which is also on Amazon for a great price. I like the fact that they're organic too.
customer_reviews.author: plynn

customer_reviews.title: Not everything works for everyone. Check your numbers...
customer_reviews.text: I don’t use these for anything but my cholesterol and triglyceride numbers. After using these daily plus some garlic and ginger, my numbers are way down. Try it, see for yourself. Everyone is different.
customer_reviews.author: chy420

customer_reviews.title: seeds don't expand
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if there is something wrong with this particular bag but the chia seeds don't expand like chia seeds I have bought from other brands in the past. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Enough for a year!
customer_reviews.text: Consider to consume one tea spoon of chia seeds a day, this bag will probably last me a whole year! The resealable zip is easy to seal up the bag.
customer_reviews.author: ParkLife

customer_reviews.title: Perfume Smells
customer_reviews.text: I am highly allergic to perfumes and the bag it was delivered in was full of the smell. You must be more careful on the packaging you use so someone like myself does not have an attack.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great product and seller
customer_reviews.text: I always read reviews before I buy a product. I have been adding chia seeds to my food for about 4 years. This is the first time I've ordered this product from this seller,and this 2lb bag. I found the product fresh and filled to the brim-no "settling" of the product from shipping. It appears fresh and I like that it is in a heavy duty package with a ziplock top and a square bottom that stands upright which means I don't have to transfer the product to another container. Very convenient. It was a quick ship and a great seller. Will order again. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: marg

customer_reviews.title: Great value, fresh and tasty.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value for a bag of Chia. These plump up well and seem fresh. They were packed adequately for shipping (not overly wrapped in excessive packaging, but protected and arrived intact).
customer_reviews.author: Northern CA mom

customer_reviews.title: Clean and a one pound qty.  price is reasonable too.
customer_reviews.text: Clean and a nice price. Like also that I could purchase 1 pound at a time. I keep mine in refrigerator as being organic preserves the quality longer. I use this for smoothies to get omega 3.
customer_reviews.author: 5  stars

customer_reviews.title: this product is worth the buy.
customer_reviews.text: my daughter told me about Chia seed. Then she told me to buy this brand. I’m super pleased with this product they’re fresh they're good and I enjoyed them. I am on my Second bag.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

product_meta.title: Viva Naturals Organic Raw Chia Seeds (2 LB)
product_meta.description:
Size:2 Pound (Pack of 1)| Style:Seeds

Chia seeds were first harvested over 3,000 years ago by the ancient Mayan, Inca and Aztec empires. Warriors used this tiny superfood during times of conquest to improve stamina and endurance. Raw, gluten-free, organic, vegan, nut-free and grain-free, these seeds make the perfect addition to any modern-day diet.

Omega 3’s: Chia Seeds are naturally preserved by an omega-3 called cinnamic acid, preventing them from going rancid and extending their shelf-life. Studies indicate omega-3’s help to reduce inflammation and improve cardiovascular health. Viva Naturals Organic Chia Seeds contain 2,440mg of omega-3’s per serving.

Fiber: Fiber has been shown to promote regularity, maintain blood sugar and promote a satiety effect. Viva Naturals Organic Chia Seeds contain 4g of fiber per serving, making it an excellent all-natural thickener and binder in all of your favourite recipes.

Suggested Uses: Chia seeds can be used as a binder in virtually any recipe because of its gel-forming ability, or can simply be sprinkled over your favourite smoothies, oatmeal, yogurt and salads. Add 1-2 tablespoons per day to amplify the nutritional integrity of your favourite dishes.

The Viva Naturals Difference: Chia seeds, derived from the purple flowers of the plant Salva hispanica, are sustainably grown in the mineral-rich soil regions of South America. Once the flowers have fully matured, they are thoroughly threshed and cleaned, yielding seeds of exquisite taste and nutritional substance. Viva Naturals selectively chooses prime quality chia seeds, supplying higher concentrations of inflammation-reducing omega-3. Viva Naturals Organic Chia Seeds are sourced directly from farmers in compliance with fair trade practices and are certified organic.
feature_bullets: NUTRIENT-DENSE SUPERFOOD - rich in omega-3 fatty acids, fiber, protein, iron and antioxidants

NEUTRAL TASTE - chia seeds are virtually tasteless and can be added to your favorite foods. For added texture and protein, we recommend sprinkling chia seeds over oatmeal or adding them to smoothies, salads or yogurt for a satisfying and filling snack.
HYDROPHILIC PROPERTIES - these mighty seeds hold up to 12x their weight offering powerful thickening abilities. Make a vegan egg substitute using 1 tablespoon of chia seeds to 3 tablespoons of water.
SUITABLE FOR ALL DIETS - this omega powerhouse supports all dietary restrictions considering they are gluten-free, vegan, nut-free, raw, low-carb and paleo-friendly.

100% ALL NATURAL, CERTIFIED ORGANIC AND NON-GMO - Viva Naturals chia seeds are sustainably sourced premium quality seeds, offering impeccable nutrition, taste and versatility. Free from unwanted additives and harmful ingredients, our unrefined chia seeds allow you to reap the full benefits of this ancient superfood.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
